channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from multiple RSS sources, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Home Prices Stagnate in The South and America’s New #1 Housing Market
item.description: Texas and Florida are seeing stagnating home prices as housing inventory booms while demand slips away. Housing is still expensive, but with more inventory, why is it staying that way? […]

item.title: Renda, which provides order fulfillment for businesses in Africa, takes in $1.9M
item.description: The logistics industry in Nigeria, like any informal sector, struggles with poor infrastructure and other inefficiencies, making it difficult for businesses — both large and small — to move and store goods. Many startups have tackled middle-mile and last-mile delivery challenges, but one untapped area is providing an end-to-end fulfillment solution. Renda, a three-year-old startup, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Lawmakers Considered Modest Public Defense Reforms. They Rejected All of Them.
item.description: With its refusal to impose oversight or consistent standards in local defense, Mississippi risks falling further behind rest of the U.S., critics say.

item.title: Truth or TV: Is Grey's Anatomy's Parkinson's 'Cure' Real?
item.description: How realistic is the Grey’s Anatomy episode that shows a Parkinson’s disease cure? A neurosurgery professor weighs in.

item.title: Contractor Nightmares: 5 Red Flags to Watch For and How to Escape a Bad Hire
item.description: What’s easier to find, a unicorn or a rock star contractor? If you asked most value-add real estate investors, the answer would be obvious: “Unicorns, of course.” We all know the inherent […]

item.title: Digital fraud detection startup BioCatch hits $1.3B valuation as Permira buys majority stake
item.description: Digital fraud detection company BioCatch has a new majority shareholder in the form of U.K private equity firm Permira. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: In This Police Youth Program, a Trail of Sexual Abuse Across the U.S.
item.description: Explorer posts, overseen by the Boy Scouts, are supposed to foster an interest in policing. They have faced nearly 200 allegations of misconduct.

item.title: Easing Marijuana Laws Doesn’t Mean the Drug Is Safer
item.description: You shouldn’t draw major conclusions about the safety of marijuana amid the recent announcement that federal regulators may reclassify the drug, experts are cautioning.

item.title: Free Money? Can You Build a Real Estate Portfolio with Zero-Interest Credit Cards?
item.description: Juggling 0% interest business credit cards is like juggling torches in a hay-covered barn. Drop one, and the whole place goes up in flames. However, if you are disciplined and […]

item.title: ButcherBox acquires ‘Shark Tank’-featured startup Truffle Shuffle
item.description: Butcherbox is known for grinding its way forward, bootstrapping to more than $600,000 worth of revenue. The company hasn’t traditionally been on the M&A path, but it today announced it is acquiring Truffle Shuffle – who you may remember from a Shark Tank episode back in 2021 (or, perhaps, The Goonies). The acquisition helps Butcher […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Campus Protests Could Shape the 2024 Elections — And Not Just the Presidency
item.description: With hundreds of arrests and more campus standoffs looming, local law enforcement officials could face consequences at the ballot box.

item.title: Are Female Doctors Better? Here's What to Know
item.description: A new study suggests female doctors may provide patients better care, especially when those patients are women. Here's what to know.

item.title: Solving the Housing Crisis: What Lawmakers Must Do to Support Investors and Boost Housing Supply
item.description: There’s a critical lack of affordable housing. This housing shortage began following the 2008 financial crisis and worsened during the pandemic, and now, not enough homes have been built to meet current […]

item.title: Freshworks acquires Device42 for $230M, appoints Dennis Woodside new CEO
item.description: Freshworks, the publicly listed SaaS firm, is acquiring U.S.-based startup Device42 for $230 million, the company disclosed in an SEC filing. Alongside the acquisition disclosure, Freshworks revealed that founder Girish Mathrubootham has stepped down as CEO. Dennis Woodside, who joined Freshworks as president in September 2022 and previously served as CEO of Motorola Mobility, will […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Killed Their Abusive Partners. Now Their Sentences Could Be Reconsidered.
item.description: Oklahoma could re-examine how it punishes people whose crimes came after years of domestic abuse. Other states may follow.

item.title: NIH’s Eliseo Pérez-Stable, MD, Talks Health Disparities, Biology, Behavior, and Culture
item.description: Eliseo Pérez-Stable, MD, director of the National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities, talks about health disparities and how his studies aim to improve interventions in clinical settings and across communities.

item.title: Rookie Investor? Never Make This $40,000 Mistake
item.description: This episode could make you $40,000. Seriously, one property management mistake cost our own expert investor, Dave Meyer, anywhere from $30,000 to $40,000, BUT it’s easier to avoid than you […]

item.title: TikTok gets Tay and Billie back with new UMG content licensing deal
item.description: Users on TikTok can once again create music clips using tracks from UMG’s catalog, a list featuring some of the biggest names in music today: Taylor Swift, Billie Eilish, and Ariana Grande. That’s because, after months of fighting, the social media platform and Universal Music Group (UMG) have finally called a truce with a new […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What Being Trans in Prison Is Really Like
item.description: Amid a wave of anti-trans legislation, and the violence that often follows, four people share their experiences in the criminal justice system.

item.title: New ‘FLiRT’ Variants Spark Summer COVID Surge Warning
item.description: A data scientist who has accurately predicted COVID waves since the beginning of the pandemic warns that a surge is on the horizon.
